results.description: Compare short-term call vs put breakeven to capture directional option-implied skew. Applied SUGGESTION1 by using two datafields (call_breakeven_10, put_breakeven_10). SUGGESTION2 not applicable (no vector fields). SUGGESTION3 not needed (coverage >0.6). SUGGESTION4 applied: these fields have high user/alpha counts (call_breakeven_10 userCount=1003). Kept KEEP_IN_MIND: implementation concise (<7 operators, 2 datafields). Confidence set to 0.78 because short-term skew often leads spot moves but can be noisy.

Use pcr_oi_270 cross-sectional zscore to capture crowding in long-dated bets. SUGGESTION1 used single strong field (pcr_oi_270) due to its very high user/alpha counts. SUGGESTION2 not applicable. SUGGESTION3 not needed. SUGGESTION4 applied: pcr_oi_270 userCount=4870. KEEP_IN_MINDs satisfied. Confidence 0.82 because large OI shifts often precede price moves.

Detect abnormally high put/call volume vs recent history using pcr_vol_30. SUGGESTION1 used the pcr_vol_30 field. SUGGESTION2 not applicable. Coverage OK. SUGGESTION4 partially: pcr_vol_30 userCount moderate. KEEP_IN_MINDs respected. Confidence 0.65 due to volume signals being transient.

Term-structure slope between forward_price_90 and forward_price_10: steepening often signals expected drift. SUGGESTION1 used two forward_price fields. SUGGESTION2 not applicable. Coverage OK. SUGGESTION4 fields have moderate counts. KEEP_IN_MINDs followed. Confidence 0.7 because forward slope encodes expectations.
